gravity.impl
Class DefaultComponent

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--gravity.impl.DefaultComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, ProxyableComponent
public class DefaultComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProxyableComponent

This is a flyweight that will be shared by all its proxy instances.

Version:

Harish Krishnaswamy

Method Detail

getInstance

public java.lang.Object getInstance()
Description copied from interface: Component
This method will return an instance (concrete or hollow) of this component. The component instance indentity is dependent on the state of the component.

Only the following is true of the returned component instance:

  • The returned component instance will be of the registered component interface type.
  • Method invocations on the returned component instance will be completed successfully provided an implementation was registered prior to the method invocation.

    The advantage of using this method is that an instance of the component may be obtained even prior to registering an implementation for the component.

    Specified by:
    getInstance in interface Component

    • registerImplementation

    public void registerImplementation(java.lang.Class compClass,
                                   java.lang.Object[] ctorDeps,
                                   ComponentCallback[] lifeCycleMethods)
    Description copied from interface: Component
    This method should be used to register an implementation for this component.

    Specified by:
    registerImplementation in interface Component
    Parameters:
    compClass - Component implementation class.
    ctorDeps - Component constructor arguments. This is simply an array of the constructor argument values that will be used in the order it is provided.
    lifeCycleMethods - Component methods to be invoked during component life cycle stages.

    setRegistrationLocation

    public void setRegistrationLocation(Location location)
    Description copied from interface: Component
    This method may be used to register the location of the component registration. The sole purpose of this method is to provide error messages with precise location information in the event of an error.

    Specified by:
    setRegistrationLocation in interface Component

    registerConstructorArguments

    public void registerConstructorArguments(java.lang.Object[] args)
    Description copied from interface: Component
    This method allows registration of the implementation's constructor arguments. These arguments will be appended to the already existing arguments. The order of the arguments will determine the constructor that will selected for instatiation.

    Specified by:
    registerConstructorArguments in interface Component

    registerCallbackMethods

    public void registerCallbackMethods(ComponentCallback[] lifeCycleMethods)
    Description copied from interface: Component
    This method allows registration of the implementation's life cycle methods. These methods will be appended to the already existing methods. The method invocations will be in the same order it has been provided.

    Specified by:
    registerCallbackMethods in interface Component

    getConcreteInstance

    public java.lang.Object getConcreteInstance()
    Description copied from interface: ProxyableComponent
    This method will return a concrete instance of this component. The component instance indentity is dependent on the state of the component. This method will throw a runtime exception if invoked prior to registering an implementation for the component.

    Specified by:
    getConcreteInstance in interface ProxyableComponent

    newInstance

    public java.lang.Object newInstance()
    Builds a service via constructor and/or setter injection.

    When the supplied array of constructor arguments is null, this method will use the setter injection strategy, otherwise it uses the constructor injection strategy.

    When both the array of constructor arguments and the map of setter properties are supplied, this method will do a combo injection (constructor injection + setter injection).

    Specified by:
    newInstance in interface ProxyableComponent
    Returns:
    Fully constructed and initialized service.
    Throws:
    UsageException - When the supplied implementation class is null.
    WrapperException - When there is any problem while building the service.
    See Also:
    DynamicWeaver.weave(Object)

    collectInstance

    public void collectInstance(java.lang.Object inst)
    Description copied from interface: Component
    This method should be used to return a component instance obtained via Component.getInstance(). This method is primarily used for returning pooled components.

    Specified by:
    collectInstance in interface Component
